intro: Pasania rodgeriana, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has smooth, dark green leaves and produces small, red berries that contain toxic seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique nocturnal blooming habit. The flowers emit a sweet fragrance that attracts nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
